title: Frustrated golfer goes on tirade after having to play awkward drain shot at US Open
description: Two-time major winner Justin Thomas has enjoyed many happy Saturdays of golf. The third round at the 2022 US Open is unlikely to rank among them.

title: Yellowstone River flooding is a 1 in 500-year event, US Geological Survey says
description: The devastating flooding that occurred along the Yellowstone River this week constitutes a 1 in 500-year event, according to a US Geological Survey (USGS) news release.

title: Steph Curry's 2022 NBA title puts him on basketball's Mt. Rushmore
description: Down 2-1, with the Boston crowd howling and baying, Stephen Curry painted his Mona Lisa.

title: Production team with 'Late Show with Stephen Colbert' arrested in House building
description: Members of a production team for "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert" were arrested by US Capitol Police in a congressional office building Thursday night and charged with unlawful entry.

title: Russian attacks take devastating toll on Ukrainian city
description: Russian attacks take a devastating toll on the city of Lysychansk, Ukraine. Thousands of people are huddled in basements and bomb shelters without running water, electricity and communications. CNN's Ben Wedeman reports.

title: The Southwest's unchecked thirst for Colorado River water could prove devastating upstream
description: Among those who love to chase trout with flies made of feathers, just the mention of a certain seven-mile stretch of Utah's Green River can turn a hardened man rhapsodic.

title: Biden is 'fine' after falling off his bike in Delaware, White House says
description: President Joe Biden is "fine," after falling off his bike Saturday during a ride in a state park near his home in Rehoboth, Delaware, a White House official said.

title: Why Lego is the best toy ever invented
description: Lego was my favorite toy as a kid. My best friend and I would spend countless hours crouched over a giant pile of bricks, using our own Lego language -- hundreds of names for hundreds of different pieces -- to communicate which one we needed and what we were building. Now that I'm a parent I'm doing the same with my own kids, and it means so much more.

title: A Philadelphia firefighter died in a building that collapsed after a fire, and 5 other people rescued
description: A Philadelphia firefighter died early Saturday in a building that collapsed soon after a fire there was extinguished, while four comrades and a city worker were pulled alive from the rubble, a fire official said.

title: Bitcoin drops below $20,000 as crypto meltdown continues
description: The price of bitcoin breached $19,000 and ethereum fell below $1,000 Saturday morning, extending the brutal crypto bear market to new lows.

title: New analysis sheds light on mysterious source of Black Death
description: As we know from our experience with Covid-19, tracking down the source of a pandemic is incredibly difficult.

title: What drove UK journalist and Brazilian researcher to risk their lives in the Amazon
description: Dom Phillips and Bruno Araujo Pereira, veterans of the Amazon, would have known the risks they faced when they set off for Atalaia do Norte in the Brazilian rainforest's remote Javari Valley -- a trip that ended in tragedy, after Brazilian authorities said Friday they had identified the remains of Phillips.

title: This New Jersey family plans to tour the East Coast and give out free books to promote childhood literacy
description: A New Jersey family plans to distribute free books along the East Coast this summer from a custom-renovated "bookmobile" in an effort to promote childhood literacy.

title: The media is awash in Trump coverage...again
description: Donald Trump has been out of office for 17 months.

title: Two killed in Sikh temple attack in Afghanistan's capital Kabul
description: Gunmen launched an attack on a Sikh Gurdwara in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Saturday, killing at least two people, Kabul police chief spokesman Khalid Zadran said.

title: 'God's Favorite Idiot' is a quirky apocalyptic comedy with an unlikely hero
description: Summertime makes me think of wedding season.

title: My father taught me about wine. Then his wine taught me about life
description: When my father unexpectedly died in 2016, I rushed home to North Carolina. The 6 hour-drive was exhausting, more emotionally than physically. Once there, I was unsettled, not just by the shock, but knowing my father died the day before on the couch I was now staring at and wouldn't dare sit on. A situation not unlike one anyone who has lost a parent has faced.

title: His first visit to the Smithsonian changed his life. Now he's leading its newest museum
description: The 18-year-old flew in from Miami wearing jeans and a denim jacket in the dead of winter.

title: Back-to-back heat waves bake the central and eastern US
description: More than 25 million people in over a dozen states are under heat alerts Saturday. From the northern Plains to the Southeast, temperatures will be in the upper 90s, with heat index levels well into the triple digits.

title: Boris Johnson's wish to pick fights with his old enemies risks making the UK a pariah
description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson and his government have spent much of this week fighting with the EU and rowing with a European human rights court, all while playing down accusations that they are breaking international law and pandering to his party's base.

title: What to know about Juneteenth now that it's a federal holiday
description: Despite Juneteenth's storied history, the holiday was largely overlooked by non-Black Americans until recent years.

title: Western Europeans wilt in early summer heatwave, compounding climate change fears
description: Spain is seeing its hottest early summer temperatures, one area of France banned outdoor events, and drought stalked Italian farmers as a heatwave sent Europeans hunting for shade and fretting over climate change.

title: The couple behind the bag that sold out in 2 minutes
description: In 2020, when the pandemic brought all nonessential travel to a grinding halt, Ami and Jason Richter had to think fast. They were running a flourishing business called Lug that sold fun travel bags and accessories and had a growing legion of fans, which included Oprah.

title: Must-watch videos of the week
An unfinished building has been named 2022's top attraction
description: Summer solstice is almost here, the longest day of the year in the Northern Hemisphere.

title: Paul McCartney at 80: A life of fun-loving fashion
description: While the former Beatle may be known for his immeasurable contribution to music, Paul McCartney also has a well-documented penchant for fashion. Largely thanks to the late Linda McCartney, an American photographer and the musician's first wife, the sometimes kooky and always frolicsome outfits worn by McCartney have been immortalized forever -- from his classic 1970s long-lapel shirts to loud knitted sweater vests.

title: 3 people assaulted with an 'edged weapon' at San Francisco International Airport, police say
description: Three people suffered injuries Friday evening at San Francisco International Airport's departure terminal after a man attacked them with an "edged weapon," authorities said.

title: Fire at Shanghai petrochemical complex kills at least one person
description: At least one person has died after a fire broke out at a petrochemical complex in Shanghai on Saturday, Chinese state media reported.

title: Sheriff says he 'never heard anybody say they were in charge' after arriving at Texas school shooting
description: Zavala County Sheriff Eusevio Salinas told CNN on Friday when he responded to the deadly shooting at an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas, he didn't hear anyone at the scene say they were in charge.

title: CNN speaks to comrade who fought with 2 Americans now feared captured by Russia
description: CNN's Sam Kiley speaks with an American who fought with two other Americans who are now feared captured by Russian forces.

title: Japan's top court says government not responsible for Fukushima damage
description: Japan's government is not liable for damages demanded by people whose lives were devastated by the Fukushima nuclear disaster, the country's top court said on Friday, the first such ruling in a series of similar cases.

title: US Open: Morikawa shares lead with qualifier Dahmen
description: Colin Morikawa and qualifier Joel Dahmen lead the charge heading into the weekend at the US Open, topping a tight leaderboard by a single stroke following Friday's second round at The Country Club.

title: Inside Space Force boot camp with recruits to US military's newest branch
description: The US Space Force has hit a critical milestone: dedicated basic training for its early recruits.

title: Putin declares end of 'the era of the unipolar world'
